name: Lingwood Common to Blakes Wood Walk, Danbury

ai.summary: A scenic 11.9 km lakeside walk from Lingwood Common to Blakes Wood via Danbury, combining woodland trails, open fields and tranquil water views. Moderate in difficulty, suitable for hikers with a reasonable level of fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain with well-defined paths, woodland tracks and gentle inclines. Expect some muddy sections after rain and uneven surfaces near water edges. The route features both shaded woodland and open lakeside sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for typical UK weather and daylight hours. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, water, snacks, and a basic first aid kit. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of other walkers and cyclists on shared sections, and inform someone of your planned route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots with good grip
Map and/or GPS device or offline navigation app
Phone with a charged battery (and offline guide if possible)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring through early autumn (roughly March to October) when the weather is milder, daylight is longer, and trails are drier. Avoid deep winter conditions if you’re not prepared for mud and limited daylight.

seo.title: Lingwood Common to Blakes Wood Walk, Danbury – 11.9 km Lakeside Hike (UK)
seo.meta_description: Explore an 11.9 km moderate lakeside walk from Lingwood Common to Blakes Wood in Danbury. Enjoy woodland trails, tranquil lakes and open landscapes on this UK hiking route.
seo.h1: Lingwood Common to Blakes Wood Walk, Danbury – 11.9 km Lakeside Trail
